Search and Process NPI Numbers with Logging

search_and_process_npi.Rd

This function searches for NPI numbers based on provided first and last names, filters results by taxonomy, and writes chunked results to CSV files. It supports retrying failed searches and ensures logging of inputs, outputs, and errors.

Usage

search_and_process_npi(
  name_data,
  npi_type = "ind",
  max_results_limit = 5L,
  valid_country = "US",
  allowed_credentials = c("MD", "DO"),
  searchable_taxonomies = c("Allergy & Immunology", "Anesthesiology", "Dermatology",
    "Family Medicine", "Internal Medicine", "Obstetrics & Gynecology", "Pediatrics",
    "Psychiatry & Neurology", "Radiology", "Surgery", "Urology"),
  chunk_size = 10,
  output_directory = NULL
)

Arguments

name_data

A data frame with columns 'first' and 'last' containing the names to search.

npi_type

The enumeration type for NPI search (e.g., "ind", "org", "all"). Default is "ind".

max_results_limit

The maximum number of search results to request for each name pair. Default is 5.

valid_country

Filter for only valid country, default is "US".

allowed_credentials

A character vector containing the credentials to filter the NPI results. Default is c("MD", "DO").

searchable_taxonomies

A character vector of taxonomies to filter NPI results. Default is a set of clinical taxonomies. A searchable list can be found at the Medicare Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk: https://data.cms.gov/provider-characteristics/medicare-provider-supplier-enrollment/medicare-provider-and-supplier-taxonomy-crosswalk/data.

chunk_size

The number of results to save per chunk. Default is 10.

output_directory

Directory to save chunked results. Default is NULL (current working directory).

Value

A combined data frame of all NPI search results.
